docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Miller used labor unions to press for equal rights for women in the workplace and broke into the male-dominated leadership of the A.F.L.-C.I.O.

headline.seo: Joyce D. Miller, Advocate for Women, Dies at 84
headline.main: Joyce D. Miller, Breaker of Glass Ceilings, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Joyce D. Miller, Breaker of Glass Ceilings, Is Dead at 84

docs.abstract: Joyce D Miller, an influential advocate for women who broke into the male-dominated leadership of the AFL-CIO, dies at age 84.
docs.snippet: Ms. Miller used labor unions to press for equal rights for women in the workplace and broke into the male-dominated leadership of the A.F.L.-C.I.O.

docs.lead_paragraph: After the release of the third straight anemic jobs report, the president asked that voters take the long view when assessing the nation’s economic fortunes.

headline.seo: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy
headline.main: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy

docs.abstract: President Obama concedes that the economy is not generating enough jobs, that the recovery is not taking hold quickly enough, and that too many Americans lack basic financial security, after the release of the third straight anemic employment report; with few signs that the labor market will strengthen much before Election Day, he is honing a vocabulary to talk about the listless economy, one that emphasizes a glass-half-full approach to the numbers and an appeal to voters to take the long view.
docs.snippet: After the release of the third straight anemic jobs report, the president asked that voters take the long view when assessing the nation’s economic fortunes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Did you hear about the discovery of the Higgs boson, people? Since it’s such exciting news, let’s see what it meant for the presidential race!
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column humorously analyzes how the discovery of subatomic particle Higgs boson at the Large Hadron Collider might influence the presidential election; notes that a program to build a similar facility in the United States was cut by the House of Representatives in 1993.
docs.snippet: Did you hear about the discovery of the Higgs boson, people? Since it’s such exciting news, let’s see what it meant for the presidential race!

docs.lead_paragraph: Though House Republicans are attacking Democrats by saying the health care law will cut Medicare by $500 billion, they have voted for just such a reduction twice since 2010.

headline.seo: Mixed Message as Republicans Claim Health Law Cuts Medicare
headline.main: Delicate Pivot as Republicans Blast Rivals on Medicare Cuts
headline.print_headline: Delicate Pivot As G.O.P. Blasts Rivals On Medicare

docs.abstract: Republicans, led by presumptive Republican nominee Mitt Romney, have attacked Pres Obama and Democrats by saying that Medicare will be cut too much as part of the health care reform law, despite the fact that House Republicans have voted for just such a reduction twice since 2010.
docs.snippet: Though House Republicans are attacking Democrats by saying the health care law will cut Medicare by $500 billion, they have voted for just such a reduction twice since 2010.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: In the worst-hit corner of the West’s brutal fire season, a racing blaze made quick work of the Flying W Ranch, and of the musical tradition of four singing cowboys.

headline.seo: Wranglers of Flying W Ranch Lose Livelihood in Wildfire
headline.main: After Wildfire, a Cowboy Band Fights to Keep a Heritage Alive
headline.print_headline: After Wildfire, a Cowboy Band Fights to Keep a Heritage Alive

docs.abstract: Flying W Wranglers, a musical group that has sung Western songs to tourists visiting the Flying W Ranch in Colorado Springs, has found itself homeless after a wildfire destroyed their venue of 54 years; the four members of the band's latest iteration are confronting the same issues as thousands of people whose homes have burned in blazes across the West.
docs.snippet: In the worst-hit corner of the West’s brutal fire season, a racing blaze made quick work of the Flying W Ranch, and of the musical tradition of four singing cowboys.

keywords.value: Wranglers of the Flying W Ranch
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Looking back to Karen Hantze Susman’s era, when female players received scant attention and few considered it a viable career option, provides perspective on how far women’s tennis has come.

headline.seo: When Skills in the Kitchen Outranked Skills on the Tennis Court
headline.main: When Skills in the Kitchen Outranked Skills on the Court
headline.print_headline: When Skills in the Kitchen Outranked Skills on the Court

docs.snippet: Looking back to Karen Hantze Susman’s era, when female players received scant attention and few considered it a viable career option, provides perspective on how far women’s tennis has come.

headline.main: Obama Promotes a Long View on Jobs

docs.abstract: Lengthening his frame of reference allows President Obama to argue that the problems of today are not principally his fault.
docs.snippet: Lengthening his frame of reference allows President Obama to argue that the problems of today are not principally his fault.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meaningless spat obscures health care issues that Mitt Romney does not want to address in order to keep the Republican Party’s conservative base happy.

headline.seo: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again, on Health Care
headline.main: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again
headline.print_headline: Mr. Romney Changes His Mind, Again

docs.abstract: Editorial contends that Mitt Romney's inconsistent arguments about the individual mandate contained within the health care reform law illustrate his inch-deep position on the issue; observes that he has no plan for addressing the nation's problematic health care system, and his confused stance indicates his willingness to pander to the Republican Party's conservative base.
docs.snippet: A meaningless spat obscures health care issues that Mitt Romney does not want to address in order to keep the Republican Party’s conservative base happy.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Mitt Romney battles President Obama for the White House, he is asking voters to condemn his rival for a health insurance mandate that is nearly identical to the one he championed in Massachusetts.

headline.main: In Defending His Health Care Plan, Romney Often Called Its Mandate a Tax
headline.print_headline: In Defending His Health Care Plan, Romney Often Called Its Mandate a Tax

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney is asking voters to condemn Pres Obama for a health insurance mandate that is nearly identical to the one he championed as the governor of Massachusetts; Romney has allied himself with the rest of the Republican Party in labeling Obama's mandate a tax, in effect asking voters to ignore his own record.
docs.snippet: As Mitt Romney battles President Obama for the White House, he is asking voters to condemn his rival for a health insurance mandate that is nearly identical to the one he championed in Massachusetts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama campaign is hoping that the glimmers of a resurgence in the Rust Belt could help lift the president to victory in the fall.

headline.seo: Obama Begins Campaign Tour of Ohio and Pennsylvania
headline.main: Obama, in Rust Belt, Offers Tough Talk on Jobs and Trade
headline.print_headline: Obama, Hitting Road in Rust Belt, Offers Tough Talk on Jobs and Trade

docs.abstract: Pres Obama sets off on a two-day bus tour of Ohio and Pennsylvania, promoting himself as a defender of American manufacturing jobs; tour will give Obama a chance to highlight the brightening economic outlook for crucial swing states in the Rust Belt.
docs.snippet: The Obama campaign is hoping that the glimmers of a resurgence in the Rust Belt could help lift the president to victory in the fall.
